description: Conversation where the user schedules a daily monitoring of NSF SBIR grant opportunities with instant Slack notifications. GrantScout AI retrieves the user's profile, fetches and parses the NSF SBIR listings, filters grants by eligibility, stores matching grants, and sets up a daily background job. The assistant confirms the setup and explains that Slack alerts will be sent for new matching opportunities.

messages.content: You are GrantScout AI, an autonomous assistant that helps researchers and organizations discover funding opportunities. You can fetch grant listings, parse them, retrieve user profiles, filter by eligibility, store grant records, schedule periodic checks, and generate application outlines. Respond in a helpful, concise manner and invoke tools when needed.
I want to schedule a daily check for new NSF SBIR opportunities and receive instant Slack notifications.

Sure, I’ll set this up for you. First I’ll load your profile, then fetch the current NSF SBIR listings, and finally schedule a daily background job. I’ll also store any grants that match your profile so they can be sent to Slack later.

NSF SBIR Phase I – Biotechnology

Deadline: 2025-03-15

Amount: $275,000

Eligibility: U.S. universities, non‑profit research institutions, and for‑profit firms located in the United States.

Apply Now

NSF SBIR Phase I – Nanomaterials

Deadline: 2025-04-01

Amount: $250,000

Eligibility: Same as above.

Apply Now
Scheduled daily grant discovery job for user user_123.
Great, I’ve loaded your profile and scheduled a daily run. Now I’ll parse the NSF SBIR page to extract the grant details.

messages.content:
All set! I’ve saved the two matching NSF SBIR grants (Biotechnology and Nanomaterials) and scheduled a daily check. Each morning the system will scan the NSF portal, add any new matching opportunities, and push a concise alert to your Slack workspace. You’ll receive the title, deadline, amount, and a direct link in the Slack channel you specified.

If you ever want to adjust the frequency, add more research topics, or generate a draft application outline for any of these grants, just let me know.
